# Department of Planning and Development - About Us

Our mission is to promote livable communities which enhance the quality of life for the present and the future by:

  * Planning for future infrastructure needs;
  * Encouraging a sense of community;
  * Embracing diversity;
  * Promoting the protection, conservation and restoration of natural and heritage resources;
  * Addressing the needs of low and moderate income populations;
  * Encouraging economic development and community revitalization;
  * Enhancing stakeholder participation;
  * Providing services, information and guidance on land use and zoning issues; and,
  * Identifying and utilizing technological innovations.



The primary purpose of the Department is to provide proposals, advice and assistance on land use, development review and zoning issues to those who make decisions on such issues in Fairfax County. The Department of Planning and Development consists of five areas: the Planning Division (PD), the Zoning Evaluation Division (ZED), the Zoning Administration Division (ZAD), the Community Revitalization Section and the Urban Centers Section. 

If you need assistance with a question, please contact the Planner of the Day. The Department of Planning and Development is located in the Herrity Building, 12055 Government Center Pkwy., Fairfax, VA 22035.

## Planning Division

The Planning Division (PD) maintains the Fairfax County Comprehensive Plan and processes all suggested and required amendments to the Plan text and map; evaluates land use and development proposals for conformity with the Comprehensive Plan and measures related environmental, development and public facility impacts.

Herrity Building, Suite 730  
Phone: 703-324-1380, TTY 711  
Fax: 703-653-9447  
dpzpd@fairfaxcounty.gov

Learn More

## Zoning Evaluation Division

The Zoning Evaluation Division (ZED) is charged with processing all zoning applications submitted to the County, and formulating recommendations through staff reports to the Planning Commission, Board of Supervisors and Board of Zoning Appeals.

Herrity Building, Suite 801  
Phone: 703-324-1290, TTY 711  
Fax: 703-803-8219  
dpzzed@fairfaxcounty.gov

Learn More

## Zoning Administration Division

The Zoning Administration Division (ZAD) enforces, maintains and administers the provisions of the Fairfax County Zoning Ordinance and Noise Ordinance.

**Zoning Permits**  
Herrity Building (Suite 250)  
Phone: 703-222-1082, TTY 711  
Fax: 703-653-7001  
DPZMailforZPRB@fairfaxcounty.gov

**Ordinance Administration**  
Herrity Building (Suite 801)  
Phone: 703-324-1314, TTY 711  
Fax: 703-803-6372  
ordadmin@fairfaxcounty.gov

**Sign Permits**  
Herrity Building (Suite 250)  
Phone: 703-324-4300, TTY 711  
Fax: 703-324-1343  
DPDMailforZPB-SPS@FairfaxCounty.gov

Learn More

## Community Revitalization Section

The Community Revitalization Section facilitates strategic redevelopment and investment opportunities in the County’s Revitalization Districts and Areas to foster economic vitality.

Herrity Building, Suite 755  
Phone: 703-324-9300, TTY 711  
Fax: 703-653-1799  
Revitalization@fairfaxcounty.gov

Learn More

## Urban Centers Section

The Urban Centers Section conducts land use planning, zoning review, urban design and plan implementation in the emerging Transit Oriented Development areas located around Silverline Metro stations in Tysons and Reston.

Herrity Building, Suite 755  
Phone: 703-324-9300, TTY 711  
Fax: 703-653-1799  
urban.centers@fairfaxcounty.gov

Learn More
